title: SpaceX begins launching Starlink second generation constellation
summary: SpaceX is set to launch a batch of 54 Starlink internet satellites – Starlink Group 5-1 – into low Earth orbit (LEO) this Wednesday, Dec. 28, 2022. Liftoff is scheduled to occur at 4:40 AM EST (09:40 UTC) from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station (CCSFS) in Florida.

title: Magnestar creates platform to predict RF interference
summary: Canadian startup Magnestar is establishing a platform to predict radio frequency interference among satellite operators.

title: SpaceX’s first “next-gen” Starlink satellites are suspiciously familiar

title: Congress adds $1.7 billion for U.S. Space Force in 2023 spending bill
summary: The 2023 omnibus spending package includes $26.3 billion for the U.S. Space Force, nearly $1.7 billion more than the Pentagon requested

title: Senate passes orbit debris cleanup bill
summary: The Senate passed legislation that would direct NASA to establish a program to remove orbital debris, but supporters of the bill will have to try again in the next Congress to enact it.
